sentence.Network_en: The Front has often been dismissed as a cranky fringe group.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent. (in the sense 'sickly, in poor health'): perhaps from obsolete (counterfeit) crank 'a rogue feigning sickness', from Dutch or German krank 'sick'

entry.tran: (想法或行为方式)古怪的，怪异的
entry.def: If you describe ideas or ways of behaving as cranky, you disapprove of them because you think they are strange.

example.ex: Vegetarianism has shed its cranky image...
